result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mckenna Leigh Chriske

records.addlTxt: Defendant Mckenna Leigh Chriske in court.  Attorney Brandon Carlson for Peter M Wolff in court for Mckenna Leigh Chriske.  Prosecuting attorney Kristian Kanekoa Lindo in court for the State of Wisconsin. Adjourned for position on preliminary hearing. Hearing scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 08:15 am.
22R 018148; Bond received at Sheriff's Department per Receipt #17306 on 9/15/22
No contact with any Walmarts, Amocos or Fleet Farm stores. Supervised when inside stores which sell merchandise by someone aware of her charges and bond - to be supervised by Z.H. or M.C.

Clerk: EZ. Defendant Mckenna Leigh Chriske in court, in custody.  Attorney Peter M Wolff in court for Mckenna Leigh Chriske.  Prosecuting attorney Stephanie L Hanson in court for the State of Wisconsin. (22CF105, 22CF106, 22CF362, 22CF364 Br. 3; Milwaukee Co. 22CM294; Waukesha Co. 21CF1704; Kenosha Co. 21CF915; Racine Co. 21CF629)  Def given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found.  State requests $30,000.00 cash bond.  Atty. Wolff requests $500-1,000.00 cash bond and states defendant is in extensive outpatient treatment and on a waiting list for inpatient treatment.  Court orders $5,000.00 cash bond.  Preliminary hearing time limits waived.  Adjourned for position on preliminary hearing.  Court directs the next hearing to be held in Branch 3.
Hearing scheduled for October 27, 2022 at 02:45 pm.
